result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas C Joers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Credit Fraud-Use to Defraud (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: count two and with any other sentence time being served. 
AS TO EACH COUNT:   Huber release for employment, medical care/treatment and school.
The Court orders the defendant referred for evaluation for particpateion in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program.

miscConds.notes: $75.00 payable to Karen P.  To be paid first.

Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees and assessments.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid by the end of supervison period or any remaining balance shall convert to civil judgment..
Obtain/maintain full time employment,  or full time school and part time employment.
Obtain mental health assessment,  and if necessary successfully complete follow up treatment.

No illegal drugs or association with drug community, drug users/dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victim Karen P. subject to modification or cancel at agent discretion and upon request of victim.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA assessment and if necessary successfully complete follow up treatment.  Cooperate with random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas C Joers in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea and sentencing hearing on today.  Joint motion for adjournment heard and granted by the court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas C Joers in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Deferred prosecution agreement.  Parties request additional time to negotiate this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas C Joers in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DPA Hearing adjourned to Branch 21.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas C Joers in court with Attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE.  

Status conference held betwee counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-16-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Karen P. or her residence or place of employment
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant Thomas C Joers in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for a scheduling conference in Branch 21.vb
